intro: Adonis sibthorpii, commonly known as the Kashmir Adonis, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes at high elevations. It features a short, stout stem with few leaves and produces numerous small, clustered flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
